item.title: Flytip, 31st July
item.description:
Resident of 7. Gardeners close dumped this over a week ago,but you'll come and clear it and the residents who do the right thing will pay Makes no sense at all and the people who did this will carry on because there isn't the will from the council to change things

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gardeners Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard not mooving /marconi house tenant rejected by warden on the interphone, 31st July
item.description:
One of my tenant at Marconi house was denied to get through the bollards she has a white car with her son and she live here . the warden replied to her : i dont believe you .... do you think its normal ? anyway she has the code and could you provide someone to fix this issue with the entrance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelphi Terrace, Waterloo, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken cement - trip hazard, 31st July
item.description:
There is a tree in this location which once had a cement/stone base, however this has now broken into several pieces which are constantly moving onto the pavement used by pedestrians. Can we either get the pieces removed or redo the concreting. It is the same issue on the opposite side outside Bayley and Sage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118-140, Ebury Street, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped builders waste, 31st July
item.description:
Resident reporting at the back of Erith Road there are garages and a dead end as no name there is a lot of flytipping, bricks, earth bits of concrete & iron, builders waste all dumped there. The Exact location is a turning off Erith Road into Rutland gate at the back, as you go go down Rutland gate you go past by road turn left into upper Holly Hill Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holly Hill Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low branches obstructing drive way, 31st July
item.description:
Regarding the property situated between the two, which appears to be unclaimed by either side, the trees growing there are extending onto our property, causing both obstruction and damage. We have attempted to trim the branches, but their growth is persistent. We are uncertain of the property's ownership and are seeking guidance on how to address this situation effectively.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Valley Close, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 31st July
item.description:
